Group explores bringing Summer Olympics to Boston

Imagine a torch relay along the Charles River or a dash up Heartbreak Hill with a gold medal at stake. A local private group wants to make that happen in 2024.

An ethical gap on staff donations

Employee contributions are legal, and elected law enforcement officials like Plymouth sheriff Joseph McDonald Jr. have long looked to their own staff to build up campaign funds, but some say employee fund-raising, no matter how passive, is inherently coercive.
  • discuss Anything wrong with employee contributions?
